subject.normal: [YouTube-API] Re: iframe-based embeds have stopped working on iOS as of a few hours ago

headers.subject: [YouTube-API] Re: iframe-based embeds have stopped working on iOS as of a few hours ago

body.para: We're also hoping for a resolution to this issue. Will there be a push soon to resolve it?

This may be a lot to ask, but in the future is there any chance you could prerelease new versions of the embed player that developers could test before your production pushes? We would be happy to be your QA as having this embed player function properly is critical to our application and user experience.
On Jul 28, 8:04 am, Jeffrey Posnick <je...@google.com> wrote:

quote.quotepara: I'm seeing the same behavior when visiting your page from an iPad. I'll ask the engineering team to investigate any potential causes—we did have a push that took place last night and it sounds like it's correlated.
quote.quotefooter: Cheers, -Jeff Posnick, YouTube API Team apiblog.youtube.com | @YouTubeDev | groups.google.com/group/youtube- api-gdata
quote.quotepara: On Jul 27, 9:01 pm, Eric Florenzano <flo...@gmail.com> wrote:
While building out my app, today I noticed that embedded videos that were working earlier today had stopped working (with no change on my part).
Here's an example, if you visit it on an iOS device, the iframe version displays a spinner and then just stays black.http://img.labnol.org/files/youtube-embed.html
Has something changed recently? If so, is there some way that we should be updating our embeds if we intend them to be viewed in an iOS web context?
